bug.author: kurt-rhee
bug.summary: Streamlit number_input reverting to default in column layout
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
Streamlit number_input reverts back to default value if clicking + or - buttons or if entering a new value in column layout. I believe that number_input with float does not work in column layout, while integer number_inputs work okay. <denchmark-link:https://discuss.streamlit.io/t/problem-with-number-input/3539>https://discuss.streamlit.io/t/problem-with-number-input/3539</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
What are the steps we should take to reproduce the bug: <denchmark-code> # --- Latitude, Longitude --- not workign in column layout, working fine in st.number_input latitude = c1.number_input('latitude', value=latitude) longitude = c1.number_input('longitude', value=longitude)
</denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
I would expect changes to the number input to not revert to default <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
reversion to default on any change <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
yes, this used to work okay, but I was not using column layouts before. <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.68 Python version: 3.7 Using Conda OS version: Windows 10 Browser version: Chrome
